title: Part a. [0‚Äì3]
stimulusHtml:
3 points

For each correct force for which the vector is drawn with the correct direction, label and point of application, 1 point was awarded.

One earned point was deducted if any components or extraneous forces are present.

title: Part b. [0‚Äì5]
stimulusHtml:
5 points

Starting with Newton‚Äôs second law (linear form):
Fnet = Ma

1 point: For expressing Fnet in terms of gravitational and frictional forces

1 point: For including the correct component of the weight
Mg sin Œ∏ ‚Äì Ff = Ma

ùõï = Iùú∂
1 point: For correct substitution of torque into Newton‚Äôs second law (angular form)

RFf = Iùú∂
RFf = (2/5) MR2ùú∂

1 point: For the correct relationship between angular and linear acceleration (either explicitly stated or used in the calculation)
ùú∂ = a / R|
RFf = (2/5) MR2 (a/R)

Solving for Ma

Ma = (5/2)Ff

Substituting into the linear equation above
Mg sin Œ∏ ‚Äì Ff = (5/2)Ff
F f =(2/7)MgsinŒ∏=(2/7)(6.0kg) 9.8m/ s 2 sin 30 ¬∞

1 point: For the correct value of Ff
Ff = 8.4 N

Notes: Credit is awarded for solutions that use the value of v calculated in c. to calculate acceleration and, from there, the value of the frictional force.

If Mg cos Œ∏ is used, the point was awarded for a value of 14.5 N.

title: Part c. [0‚Äì3]
stimulusHtml:
3 points

1 point: For an expression of conservation of energy

1 point: For including gravitational potential energy, translational kinetic energy and rotational kinetic energy in a correct energy equation or statement
MgŒîh= 1 2 M v 2 + 1 2 I œâ 2

MgdsinŒ∏= 1 2 M v 2 + 1 2 2 5 M R 2 œâ 2

œâ=v/R

MgdsinŒ∏= 1 2 M v 2 + 1 5 M v 2 = 7 10 M v 2

v= (10/7)gdsinŒ∏ = (10/7) 9.8m/ s 2 (4.0m) sin 30 ¬∞

1 point: For a correct numerical answer

v = 5.3 m/s

ALTERNATIVE SOLUTION (kinematics method)

1 point: For determination of the linear acceleration in terms of mass and frictional force

a = 5Ff/2M from work show in part b.

a = 5(8.4 N)/2(6.0 kg) = 3.5 m/s2

1 point: For a correct substitution into an appropriate kinematics equation using v0 = 0

title: Part d. [0‚Äì3]
stimulusHtml:
3 points

1 point: For a correct statement of conservation of momentum
Mivi = Mfvf
vf = (Mi / Mf ) vi

1 point: For correctly equating vi with the horizontal component of the ball as it leaves the roof

1 point: For setting Mf equal to the total mass of the ball and the wagon/box
v f = M i / M f vcosŒ∏=[(6.0kg)/(18.0kg)] 5.3m/ s 2 cos 30 ¬∞
vf = 1.5 m/s

title: Unit point [0‚Äì1]
stimulusHtml: 1 point: For correct units in at least two of the parts b., c., and d.
